intro: Cynoglossospermum marginatum, commonly known as the marginate tongueplant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub, with hairy stems and linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and often have a distinctive tongue-like appearance. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments.
